go_data.justification: Activated Ire1 promotes splicing of the transcription factor XBP1 in response to accumulation of misfolded proteins in the ER.
The combined activity of the activated XBP1, ATF4 and ATF6 transcription factors promotes the expression of a multitude of factors supporting protein folding.
As a transcription factor, XBP1 localizes to the nucleus to regulate the expression of target genes.
